title: How to Log Out of Netflix on PlayStation 3

steps.headline: Open the Netflix app.
steps.description: If you're currently signed in, you can sign out from within the Netflix app on the PS3. The Netflix app is in the "TV/Video Services" section. Press ✕ to open it.

steps.headline: Press the .O button on the PS3 controller.
steps.description: This will open the Netflix control menu. You can also scroll to the very top of your Netflix list to find the menu.

steps.headline: Select the Gear button.
steps.description: This will open the Settings menu.

steps.headline: Select "Sign Out" at the bottom of the Settings menu.
steps.description: After confirming, you'll be signed out of Netflix on the PS3. You can now log in with a different account or setup another free trial.

steps.headline: Visit the Netflix website on your computer.
steps.description: Open netflix.com in your web browser.

steps.headline: Sign in with your Netflix account.
steps.description: Sign in with the same account that is currently signed in on the PS3.

steps.headline: Click the current profile in the upper-right corner.
Select "Your Account."
steps.description: This will open your Netflix account settings.

steps.headline: Click the "Sign out of all devices" link.
steps.description: You'll find this in the Settings section. After confirming, you'll be signed out of Netflix on every device associated with your Netflix account, including your PS3. When you launch Netflix again, you'll be prompted to sign in or start a new trial.

methods.name: Signing Out if You Can't Sign In

steps.headline: Start the Netflix app.
steps.description: You'll find it in the "TV/Video Services" section of your PS3's menu. If you are having problems logging into Netflix because someone else's account is on it, you can reset the app using this method.

steps.headline: Immediately press and hold Start and Select.
steps.description: You'll need to start holding these buttons as soon as you load the app. After a moment, a message will appear asking "Do you want to reset your Netflix settings and re-register?" If the message does not appear and Netflix opens, you'll need to close the app and try again.

steps.headline: Select "Yes" to sign out of Netflix.
steps.description: This will remove the account that is currently associated with the app and reset it. You'll be prompted to log in or start a trial when you launch the Netflix app next.

text: Signing Out in the App Open the Netflix app. If you're currently signed in, you can sign out from within the Netflix app on the PS3. The Netflix app is in the "TV/Video Services" section. Press ✕ to open it. Press the .O button on the PS3 controller. This will open the Netflix control menu. You can also scroll to the very top of your Netflix list to find the menu. Select the Gear button. This will open the Settings menu. Select "Sign Out" at the bottom of the Settings menu. After confirming, you'll be signed out of Netflix on the PS3. You can now log in with a different account or setup another free trial. Using the Netflix Website Visit the Netflix website on your computer. Open netflix.com in your web browser. Sign in with your Netflix account. Sign in with the same account that is currently signed in on the PS3. Click the current profile in the upper-right corner. This will open another menu. Select "Your Account." This will open your Netflix account settings. Click the "Sign out of all devices" link. You'll find this in the Settings section. After confirming, you'll be signed out of Netflix on every device associated with your Netflix account, including your PS3. When you launch Netflix again, you'll be prompted to sign in or start a new trial. Signing Out if You Can't Sign In Start the Netflix app. You'll find it in the "TV/Video Services" section of your PS3's menu. If you are having problems logging into Netflix because someone else's account is on it, you can reset the app using this method. Immediately press and hold Start and Select. You'll need to start holding these buttons as soon as you load the app. After a moment, a message will appear asking "Do you want to reset your Netflix settings and re-register?" If the message does not appear and Netflix opens, you'll need to close the app and try again. Select "Yes" to sign out of Netflix. This will remove the account that is currently associated with the app and reset it. You'll be prompted to log in or start a trial when you launch the Netflix app next.
